alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 29 at 1:20AM CDT until June 29 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM MDT/145 AM CDT/ FOR WESTERN HITCHCOCK AND EASTERN DUNDY COUNTIES... At 1219 AM MDT/119 AM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles west of Stratton, or 13 miles northeast of Benkelman, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...At Midnight MDT, baseball size hail was observed 15 miles north of Benkelman. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Benkelman, Stratton and Max. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
